intro: Castilla daguensis, commonly known as the Mexican velvet tree, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous small, winged seeds. Castilla daguensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
